review_text:
The place is great for two people. Small space, but very comfortable and well laid out. The kitchen was great and well stocked for basic food prep so you don't have to go out for everything. Bed was comfortable. TV was nice (didn't use it much) and internet worked great. The bathroom was very nice. View windows and high ceilings were awesome.
A couple of noteworthy items:
One less than ideal feature was the staircase up from the street. My foot was in a cast during our visit (unexpectedly) and the stairs were a real pain. It is a significant staircase and there is no elevator. It is not ADA friendly. That said, I did the stairs at least once a day.
There is no parking in front of the building. Maybe I was more sensitive to it because I was in a foot cast, but you'll be at least a block away and there are a bunch of different types of parking in downtown Ellensburg, eg, motorcycle only, 15 minute parking, 3 hour parking, no overnight parking, no parking from 4AM-6AM, unlimited, or any combination depending on the day of the week. So you really have to pay attention to avoid ticket/tow.
Last but not least, noise. It is right next door to the loudest bar in Ellensburg and the party kicks off at 11:00 and goes until close. Other reviews talked about noise, but let me tell you it is LOUD. There is a note in the room with a number to complain to the police, but the police were already there several times throughout the night. Honestly, the bar wasn't really the problem (music wise they were fine). It was when the patrons left the bar and felt the need to communicate with what sounded like garbage can lids and megaphones.
Saturday morning I bought earplugs from the hardware store across the street.
Despite those things, I would stay again. Just probably not on a busy weekend like Rodeo or homecoming unless I plan on closing the bars.

Also, downtown in a college town on a weekend night in Ellensburg means that the cowboys and college kids are whooping it up, but, when in Rome, toga party, right? Check out the nearby watering holes and say hello to the friendly locals: I am glad I did. Having said all that, Ellensburg is a peaceful and orderly town, with a 10PM sound curfew. Pay attention to the parking signs - overnight parking is very close by and Susan will provide a map. Bonus: take a walk by turning right and going south on Pearl street two blocks: there is an incredible art installation. Susan's studio is perfectly located for eating, entertainment, book and record shopping, and don't forget the seasonal Saturday farmer's market.
